properties.name: kuber.autoload.batch-size
properties.description: Batch size for bulk writes to persistence store. Records are accumulated and written in batches for better performance. Batch writes use async mode (WAL written but not synced per batch). Default: 32768 records per batch. Set to 1 to disable batching (write each record individually).

properties.name: kuber.autoload.create-directories
properties.description: Whether to create directories if they don't exist

properties.name: kuber.autoload.directory
properties.description: Base directory for autoload (contains inbox and outbox subfolders)

properties.name: kuber.autoload.enabled
properties.description: Whether autoload is enabled

properties.name: kuber.autoload.file-encoding
properties.description: File encoding

properties.name: kuber.autoload.max-records-per-file
properties.description: Maximum records to process per file (0 = unlimited)

properties.name: kuber.autoload.scan-interval-seconds
properties.description: Scan interval in seconds

properties.name: kuber.autoload.warm-percentage
properties.description: Percentage of cache capacity to warm after autoload completes. This proactively loads data into memory in a background thread. Set to 0 to disable automatic warming (rely on lazy loading via GET). Default: 10 (load 10% of capacity).  This setting is also used for: - Startup loading from existing RocksDB database - Restore from backup - Manual reload from persistence  @since 1.6.1

properties.name: kuber.backup.backup-directory
properties.description: Directory where backup files are stored. Each backup file is named: <region>.<timestamp>.backup

properties.name: kuber.backup.batch-size
properties.description: Batch size for reading/writing entries during backup/restore.

properties.name: kuber.backup.compress
properties.description: Whether to compress backup files (gzip).

properties.name: kuber.backup.create-directories
properties.description: Whether to create directories if they don't exist.

properties.name: kuber.backup.cron
properties.description: Cron expression for scheduled backups. Default: "0 0 23 * * *" (11:00 PM daily) Format: second minute hour day-of-month month day-of-week Examples:   "0 0 23 * * *" - 11:00 PM daily   "0 0 2 * * *"  - 2:00 AM daily   "0 0 0/6 * * *" - Every 6 hours (starting at midnight)   "0 30 1 * * SUN" - 1:30 AM every Sunday

properties.name: kuber.backup.enabled
properties.description: Whether backup is enabled. When enabled, regions are periodically backed up to the backup directory.

properties.name: kuber.backup.file-encoding
properties.description: File encoding for backup files.

properties.name: kuber.backup.max-backups-per-region
properties.description: Maximum number of backup files to keep per region. Older backups are deleted when this limit is exceeded. Set to 0 to keep all backups (no automatic cleanup).

properties.name: kuber.backup.restore-directory
properties.description: Directory to monitor for restore files. Place backup files here to trigger automatic restore. Files are moved to backupDirectory after restore completes.

properties.name: kuber.base.datadir
properties.description: Base data directory for all Kuber data files. All relative paths for persistence, autoload, backup, etc. are resolved from this directory. Default: ./kuberdata

properties.name: kuber.cache.cache-implementation
properties.description: Cache implementation to use for value caches. Supports: CAFFEINE (default), GUAVA, EHCACHE. The cache implementation can be changed without modifying code.  @since 1.5.0

properties.name: kuber.cache.collections-implementation
properties.description: Collections implementation to use for internal collections (Map, List, Set, Queue, Deque). Supports: DEFAULT (uses Java concurrent collections). The collections implementation can be changed without modifying code.  @since 1.5.0

properties.name: kuber.cache.default-ttl-seconds
properties.description: Default TTL in seconds (-1 for no expiration)

properties.name: kuber.cache.enable-statistics
properties.description: Enable statistics collection

properties.name: kuber.cache.eviction-policy
properties.description: Eviction policy: LRU, LFU, FIFO

properties.name: kuber.cache.global-max-memory-entries
properties.description: Global maximum number of entries across ALL regions combined. When set (> 0), the total in-memory entries across all regions will not exceed this value. Memory is allocated proportionally based on each region's data size and configured limits. Set to 0 to disable global limiting (each region uses its own limit).

properties.name: kuber.cache.max-key-length-bytes
properties.description: Maximum allowed key length in bytes. Keys exceeding this length will be rejected with an error. The key and value will be logged for debugging purposes.  This limit applies to ALL persistence stores (LMDB, RocksDB, MongoDB, etc.) and prevents issues with database-specific key length limits.  Default: 256 bytes (sufficient for most use cases) Maximum recommended: 1024 bytes (for compatibility with all backends)

properties.name: kuber.cache.max-memory-entries
properties.description: Default maximum number of entries to keep in memory per region. This is used when no region-specific limit is configured.

properties.name: kuber.cache.memory-eviction-batch-size
properties.description: Number of entries to evict per batch during memory pressure.

properties.name: kuber.cache.memory-high-watermark-percent
properties.description: High watermark percentage for heap memory. When heap usage exceeds this threshold, eviction begins.

properties.name: kuber.cache.memory-low-watermark-percent
properties.description: Low watermark percentage for heap memory. Eviction continues until heap usage drops below this threshold.

properties.name: kuber.cache.memory-watcher-enabled
properties.description: Enable automated memory management watcher. When enabled, heap usage is monitored and cache entries are evicted to persistence when memory exceeds the high watermark.

properties.name: kuber.cache.memory-watcher-interval-ms
properties.description: Interval in milliseconds for memory watcher checks.

properties.name: kuber.cache.off-heap-key-index
properties.description: Use off-heap (direct memory) for key index storage. When enabled, keys are stored in DRAM outside the Java heap, providing: - Zero GC pressure for key storage - Better scalability for millions of keys - No GC pauses affecting key lookups  Default: false (use on-heap ConcurrentHashMap)

properties.name: kuber.cache.off-heap-key-index-initial-size-mb
properties.description: Initial size in MB for off-heap key index per region. Only used when offHeapKeyIndex is enabled. The buffer grows automatically up to offHeapKeyIndexMaxSizeMb.

properties.name: kuber.cache.off-heap-key-index-max-size-mb
properties.description: Maximum size in MB for off-heap key index per region. Only used when offHeapKeyIndex is enabled.

properties.name: kuber.cache.persistence-batch-size
properties.description: Batch size for async persistence

properties.name: kuber.cache.persistence-interval-ms
properties.description: Interval for async persistence in milliseconds

properties.name: kuber.cache.persistent-mode
properties.description: Whether to use persistent mode (sync writes to MongoDB)

properties.name: kuber.cache.region-memory-limits
properties.description: Per-region memory limits. Keys are region names, values are max entries. If a region is not specified here, maxMemoryEntries is used as default. Example: { "customers": 50000, "products": 200000 }

properties.name: kuber.cache.region-warm-object-counts
properties.description: Per-region warm object counts. Keys are region names, values are minimum number of objects to keep warm (in-memory) for that region.  Example configuration:   kuber.cache.region-warm-object-counts.trade=100000   kuber.cache.region-warm-object-counts.reference=50000   kuber.cache.region-warm-object-counts.session=10000  If a region is not specified here, it falls back to default behavior (no guaranteed minimum, subject to normal eviction policies).  Note: The warm object count cannot exceed the total keys in the region. If configured higher, it will be capped at the region's key count.  @since 1.7.6

properties.name: kuber.cache.ttl-cleanup-interval-seconds
properties.description: TTL cleanup interval in seconds

properties.name: kuber.cache.value-cache-limit-check-interval-ms
properties.description: Interval in milliseconds for count-based cache limit checks. This runs separately from memory watcher.

properties.name: kuber.cache.value-cache-limit-enabled
properties.description: Enable count-based value cache limiting per region. When enabled, limits the number of values kept in memory based on percentage of total keys or absolute count (whichever is lower). This runs independently of memory pressure-based eviction.

properties.name: kuber.cache.value-cache-max-entries
properties.description: Maximum absolute number of values to keep in memory per region. Used in conjunction with valueCacheMaxPercent (whichever is lower wins). For example, if a region has 100,000 keys and valueCacheMaxPercent=20, the limit would be 20,000, but if valueCacheMaxEntries=10,000, then only 10,000 values will be kept in memory.

properties.name: kuber.cache.value-cache-max-percent
properties.description: Maximum percentage of total keys in a region to keep in value cache. For example, 20 means only 20% of keys can have their values in memory. Used in conjunction with valueCacheMaxEntries (whichever is lower wins).

properties.name: kuber.cache.warm-object-check-interval-ms
properties.description: Interval in milliseconds for warm object maintenance checks. The warm object service runs at this interval to ensure regions have their configured minimum warm objects in memory.  @since 1.7.6

properties.name: kuber.cache.warm-object-load-batch-size
properties.description: Batch size for loading warm objects from disk. When the warm object service needs to load objects from disk to meet the warm object target, it loads them in batches of this size.  @since 1.7.6

properties.name: kuber.cache.warm-objects-enabled
properties.description: Enable warm object maintenance per region. When enabled, the system proactively maintains a minimum number of "warm" (in-memory) objects per region, loading from disk if necessary. This ensures frequently accessed data remains in memory for fast access.  @since 1.7.6

properties.name: kuber.mongo.connection-pool-size
properties.description: Connection pool size

properties.name: kuber.mongo.connection-timeout-ms
properties.description: Connection timeout in milliseconds

properties.name: kuber.mongo.database
properties.description: Database name

properties.name: kuber.mongo.socket-timeout-ms
properties.description: Socket timeout in milliseconds

properties.name: kuber.mongo.uri
properties.description: MongoDB connection URI

properties.name: kuber.mongo.write-concern-acknowledged
properties.description: Enable write concern acknowledgment

properties.name: kuber.network.bind-address
properties.description: Bind address

properties.name: kuber.network.connection-timeout-ms
properties.description: Connection/session idle timeout in milliseconds. Sessions are closed after this period of inactivity. Can be adjusted per-session using CLIENT SETTIMEOUT command. Set to 0 to disable timeout (not recommended).

properties.name: kuber.network.decoder-max-line-length
properties.description: Maximum line length for text decoder

properties.name: kuber.network.io-processor-count
properties.description: IO processor count (0 = auto-detect)

properties.name: kuber.network.max-connections
properties.description: Maximum number of concurrent connections

properties.name: kuber.network.port
properties.description: Redis protocol port

properties.name: kuber.network.read-buffer-size
properties.description: Read buffer size

properties.name: kuber.network.read-timeout-ms
properties.description: Read timeout in milliseconds

properties.name: kuber.network.write-buffer-size
properties.description: Write buffer size

properties.name: kuber.node-id
properties.description: Unique node identifier

properties.name: kuber.persistence.lmdb.map-size
properties.description: Maximum database size (map size) in bytes. LMDB memory-maps the database using virtual address space. Default: 1TB (1024GB). This is safe on 64-bit systems.  IMPORTANT NOTES: - This reserves VIRTUAL address space, NOT physical disk or RAM - Actual disk usage grows only as data is written (sparse file) - Physical RAM usage is managed by OS page cache (only active pages) - 64-bit systems have 128TB+ virtual space, so 1TB is trivial - Can be set much larger than available RAM or disk without issues  If you see "Environment mapsize reached" error, increase this value and restart. The map size cannot be changed while database is running.  Common values:   100GB = 107374182400   500GB = 536870912000   1TB   = 1099511627776 (default)   2TB   = 2199023255552   4TB   = 4398046511104

properties.name: kuber.persistence.lmdb.path
properties.description: Path to LMDB database directory

properties.name: kuber.persistence.lmdb.sync-writes
properties.description: Whether to sync writes immediately. true = safer but slower (MDB_NOSYNC disabled) false = faster but risk of data loss on crash (MDB_NOSYNC enabled)

properties.name: kuber.persistence.postgresql.connection-timeout-ms
properties.description: Connection timeout in milliseconds

properties.name: kuber.persistence.postgresql.idle-timeout-ms
properties.description: Idle timeout in milliseconds

properties.name: kuber.persistence.postgresql.max-lifetime-ms
properties.description: Maximum connection lifetime in milliseconds

properties.name: kuber.persistence.postgresql.min-idle
properties.description: Minimum idle connections

properties.name: kuber.persistence.postgresql.password
properties.description: Database password

properties.name: kuber.persistence.postgresql.pool-size
properties.description: Connection pool size

properties.name: kuber.persistence.postgresql.url
properties.description: PostgreSQL JDBC URL

properties.name: kuber.persistence.postgresql.username
properties.description: Database username

properties.name: kuber.persistence.rocksdb.compaction-cron
properties.description: Cron expression for scheduled compaction. Default: "0 0 2 * * ?" runs at 2:00 AM daily.  Format: second minute hour day-of-month month day-of-week Examples:   "0 0 2 * * ?"     - 2:00 AM daily   "0 0 3 * * SUN"   - 3:00 AM every Sunday   "0 0 1,13 * * ?"  - 1:00 AM and 1:00 PM daily   "0 0 * * * ?"     - Every hour

properties.name: kuber.persistence.rocksdb.compaction-enabled
properties.description: Enable automatic compaction to reclaim disk space

properties.name: kuber.persistence.rocksdb.path
properties.description: Path to RocksDB database directory

properties.name: kuber.persistence.sqlite.path
properties.description: Path to SQLite database file

properties.name: kuber.persistence.sync-individual-writes
properties.description: Whether to synchronously write individual PUT/SET operations to disk.  When false (default - async mode): - Individual writes are saved to memory immediately (value cache + key index) - Disk write happens asynchronously in background - Better performance (10-100x faster for individual writes) - Data is eventually consistent with disk - Risk: If crash occurs before async write completes, that entry is lost  When true (sync mode): - Each write waits for disk confirmation before returning - Maximum durability - data survives power loss - Slower performance (~1-5ms per write due to fsync)  Batch operations (autoload) always use async mode regardless of this setting.  Default: false (async for better performance)

properties.name: kuber.persistence.type
properties.description: Persistence store type: lmdb, rocksdb, mongodb, sqlite, postgresql, memory Default: lmdb (fastest reads via memory-mapping, no external dependencies)  LMDB is recommended for most use cases due to: - Zero-copy reads via memory mapping - Excellent read performance - ACID transactions - No recovery needed after crash - Simple deployment (no external services)

properties.name: kuber.prometheus.enabled
properties.description: Enable Prometheus metrics endpoint. When enabled, metrics are exposed at /actuator/prometheus

properties.name: kuber.prometheus.include-jvm-metrics
properties.description: Include JVM metrics. When enabled, JVM memory, GC, and thread metrics are exported.

properties.name: kuber.prometheus.include-latency-histograms
properties.description: Include operation latency histograms. When enabled, detailed latency distribution is tracked. Note: May increase memory usage.

properties.name: kuber.prometheus.include-region-metrics
properties.description: Include per-region metrics. When enabled, individual region statistics are exported.

properties.name: kuber.prometheus.latency-buckets
properties.description: Histogram bucket boundaries in microseconds for latency metrics. Only used when includeLatencyHistograms is true.

properties.name: kuber.prometheus.metric-prefix
properties.description: Custom metric prefix. All Kuber metrics will use this prefix. Default: kuber

properties.name: kuber.prometheus.update-interval-ms
properties.description: Metrics update interval in milliseconds. How often to refresh cache metrics. Default: 5000ms (5 seconds)

properties.name: kuber.publishing.brokers
properties.description: Centralized broker definitions. Key is broker name, value is broker configuration.

properties.name: kuber.publishing.queue-capacity
properties.description: Queue capacity for pending events

properties.name: kuber.publishing.regions
properties.description: Region-specific publishing configuration. Key is region name, value is publishing config.

properties.name: kuber.publishing.thread-pool-size
properties.description: Thread pool size for async publishing

properties.name: kuber.replication.heartbeat-interval-ms
properties.description: Heartbeat interval in milliseconds

properties.name: kuber.replication.primary-check-interval-ms
properties.description: Primary check interval in milliseconds

properties.name: kuber.replication.sync-batch-size
properties.description: Batch size for sync operations

properties.name: kuber.replication.sync-timeout-ms
properties.description: Sync timeout in milliseconds

properties.name: kuber.secure.folder
properties.description: Folder for sensitive configuration files (users.json, apikeys.json). This folder will be created automatically if it doesn't exist. Default: ./secure

properties.name: kuber.security.api-keys-file
properties.description: Path to API keys JSON file. Default: secure/apikeys.json @since 1.7.3 - Moved to secure folder

properties.name: kuber.security.auto-create-region-roles
properties.description: Whether to auto-create region roles when a new region is created. When enabled, creates {region}_readonly, {region}_readwrite, {region}_full roles. Default: true @since 1.7.3

properties.name: kuber.security.rbac-enabled
properties.description: Whether to enforce RBAC authorization on cache operations. When enabled, users must have appropriate roles to read/write/delete from regions. Default: true @since 1.7.3

properties.name: kuber.security.redis-password
properties.description: Password for Redis AUTH command (empty = no auth)

properties.name: kuber.security.roles-file
properties.description: Path to roles.json file for RBAC role definitions. Default: secure/roles.json @since 1.7.3

properties.name: kuber.security.session-timeout-minutes
properties.description: Session timeout in minutes

properties.name: kuber.security.users-file
properties.description: Path to users.json file for authentication. Default: secure/users.json @since 1.7.3 - Moved to secure folder, supports RBAC roles

properties.name: kuber.shutdown.api-enabled
properties.description: Enable REST API shutdown endpoint. When enabled, POST /api/admin/shutdown triggers graceful shutdown. Requires valid API key authentication.

properties.name: kuber.shutdown.check-interval-ms
properties.description: How often to check for shutdown file (in milliseconds). Default: 5000ms (5 seconds)

properties.name: kuber.shutdown.file-enabled
properties.description: Enable file-based shutdown monitoring. When enabled, Kuber watches for a shutdown file and initiates graceful shutdown when the file is detected.

properties.name: kuber.shutdown.file-path
properties.description: Path to the shutdown signal file. Create this file to trigger graceful shutdown. The file is deleted after shutdown is initiated.  Default: kuber.shutdown (in working directory)

properties.name: kuber.shutdown.phase-delay-seconds
properties.description: Delay between shutdown phases in seconds. Each phase waits this long before proceeding to ensure clean resource release. Default: 5 seconds

properties.name: kuber.version
properties.description: Application version. Read from application.properties: kuber.version Used for logging, API responses, and UI display. @since 1.6.1

properties.name: kuber.zookeeper.base-path
properties.description: Base path for Kuber nodes

properties.name: kuber.zookeeper.connect-string
properties.description: ZooKeeper connection string

properties.name: kuber.zookeeper.connection-timeout-ms
properties.description: Connection timeout in milliseconds

properties.name: kuber.zookeeper.enabled
properties.description: Whether ZooKeeper is enabled

properties.name: kuber.zookeeper.retry-base-sleep-ms
properties.description: Retry policy - initial sleep time

properties.name: kuber.zookeeper.retry-max-attempts
properties.description: Retry policy - max retries

properties.name: kuber.zookeeper.session-timeout-ms
properties.description: Session timeout in milliseconds
